revised_title: Differential Male Genetic Success and Gene Flow in Experimentally Manipulated Mouse Populations
tldr: This study examines the genetic success and gene flow in a population of mice after introducing mice from the islands of May and Eday. The results show that introduced male genes spread more extensively than maternally inherited genes, suggesting that sexual selection plays a role in gene flow. This research has implications for understanding the genetic structure of populations and the reintroduction of endangered mammals into wild populations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Evolution
